ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Ital 120 was great this semester. I learned a lot and feel like I am a much better speaker.

I think this course did an excellent job in providing me with a basic understanding of Italian. I feel confident in my ability to write and speak and especially excited to continue on in my study of Italian.
I learned more advanced grammar/vocabulary and, in the process, reviewed a lot of the material from last semester, as well as learned more about Italian culture through literature, film, and music.
Great continuation of L1 Italian. Learned most of the Italian grammar and feel confident to use Italian in basic conversations. Some introduction to Italian culture which was nice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: doesn't take the learning too fast which is nice

I wish that the course was less based out of the text book. Julia, however, made sure that we did other things besides simply going over the textbook, which I appreciated a lot. She was and is a great teacher!
I think this course moved at an excellent pace. I enjoyed that we had a lot of tests because we were constantly learning new things.
More of reading in Italian to help expand the vocabulary. I feel like vocabulary is definitely an area that was overlooked. Grammar on the other hand was thought exceptionally.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great language that is fairly easy to learn with these teachers
I would recommend this course to another student because it has been fun and interesting to learn Italian this year.
Italian is a good language to take if you have prior language experience in the Romance languages - pretty easy to catch on to verbs/syntax/etc
Yes! This was a great course that continued on the basics of the language that we learned in the first semester.
Definitely a great sequel to L1. All the Italian grammar is covered so if you hate grammar it might be challenging. However, if you expect to be able to speak Italian freely extra learning is needed.
